Identifies and documents requirements by establishing end user interaction. Maintain an understanding of the manufacturing processes, and Syncade MES recipes. Administrates, maintains and executes change control activities related to Manufacturing Execution System and specialized manufacturing applications. Generates and maintains the related Standard Operating Procedures and perform required system maintenance activities. Developers functional specifications and requirements for integrated applications Provides ongoing training to users on procedures, protocols and computer systems. Provides technical advice on the selection of equipment and system software relation to integration with current systems. Recommends acceptance of the computer system, as determined from the tests performed on the Protocol and analyzes data in order to determine acceptability. Recommends actions to be taken if the system is not accepted. Assists in any system related Quality Event Investigation in alignment with corporate directives and Site procedures. Performs process analysis and recommends improvements to existing processes and participates proactively as a team member of implementation projects for new integrated business application. Evaluates and closes change control documentation assuring the validated and compliance state of the environments.

The candidate will be responsible for developing applications and tools in support of data visualization and reporting, including the use of R Shiny as the reporting layer, Web programming in JavaScript/CSS for customized UI, and R and/or SAS for any pre-processing/data manipulation.

Cell Therapy is one of the most groundbreaking new forms of cancer treatments being studied today. With therapies only in their infancy and BMS’s continued investment in our Cell Therapy capabilities, the growth potential of this science, your career, and the ability to help patients are incredible.
We are seeking a skilled Sr. Data Automation Engineer I to join the Assay Automation and Data team. Our team is responsible for developing novel automated systems/tools to streamline the execution and analysis of cell therapy assays in development and commercial settings. A successful candidate will be responsible for supporting and implementing automated data acquisition and analysis tools for unique biochemical and cell-based assays. The ability to work independently as an expert while partnering with assay developers and our internal development team is critical to the role. An ideal candidate will have demonstrated experience with a diverse set of automation equipment and software packages. Familiarity with flow cytometry gating and analysis is a must.
